required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of HemoStyp as an Adjunct for Management of Secondary Hemostasis in the Operative Setting
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of HemoStyp as an Adjunct for Management of Secondary Hemostasis in the Operative Setting

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess efficacy and safety of HemoStyp as an adjunct for management of secondary hemostasis in the operative setting.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a prospective, non-inferiority, multi-center, randomized, open-label trial to compare HemoStyp with SurgicelÂ® in the management of bleeding during surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Non-inferiority of HemoStyp versus Surgicel measured using time to hemostasis from start of study treatment at target bleeding site until 10 minutes after treatment initiation.
primary_outcome.description: Time to hemostasis from start of study treatment at target bleeding site until 10 minutes after treatment initiation. The non-inferiority of HemoStyp versus Surgicel will be evaluated. If the criteria for non-inferiority are satisfied, a superiority analysis will be performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving Hemostasis between 2 minutes and 10 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects achieving hemostasis at the target bleeding site at 2 minutes, 5 minutes and 10 minutes following the start of study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Subjects Achieving Intraoperative Hemostasis at the Target Bleeding Site
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with intraoperative hemostasis at the target bleeding site during the intraoperative period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of Subjects with intraoperative re-bleeding from the target bleeding site
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of subjects with intraoperative re-bleeding from the target bleeding site post hemostasis

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of subjects requiring surgical re-exploration up to 30 days after surgery for re-bleeding from the target bleeding site
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative re-bleeding from the target bleeding site requiring surgical re exploration up to 30 days after surgery.

arm_group.description: Subjects with an appropriate target bleeding site will have Hemostyp applied in accordance to instructions for use.
Subjects with an appropriate target bleeding site will have Surgicel applied in accordance to instructions for use.

intervention.description: During elective surgical procedure (non-laparoscopic thoracic, cardiac, abdominal, or vascular surgery) subject has mild to moderate soft tissue, vascular or parenchymal bleeding present at target bleeding site after primary standard conventional surgical hemostatic methods are proven to be ineffective or impractical will have Hemostyp applied in accordance to instructions for use.

During elective surgical procedure (non-laparoscopic thoracic, cardiac, abdominal, or vascular surgery) subject has mild to moderate soft tissue, vascular or parenchymal bleeding present at target bleeding site after primary standard conventional surgical hemostatic methods are proven to be ineffective or impractical will have Surgicel applied in accordance to instructions for use.
